initial_divs_soup:
"KIVI" KI + vigilare

  • Düsseldorf, Germany
  • August 2020
  • Media Authority of NRW
Our goals: Supporting the monitoring process in its research on the internet which means an automatic research on the web for potential violations of the law and processing of automatically generated and pre-categorised findings by the monitoring team. In the context of employee protection, we also wanted to avoid the unmediated reception of sometimes very incriminating content. Therefore we developed an AI tool, named KIVI, that supports us in sifting through legal violations on the internet. The automation of the screening enables us to check a significantly larger number of online content than before.
  • Closed source
  • 50/50/- (% m/f/d)
  • Public

Industrial Sectors:

Information and communication,

Usage of AI:

Speech and Sound Recognition, Information Retrieval

Generation of AI:

Traditional Machine Learning (Linear Regression, CART, SVM, etc.), Deep Learning (CNN, Transformers, etc.)

initial_divs_soup:
ADIS

  • Rotterdam, Netherlands
  • January 2021
  • The Ocean Cleanup Projects B.V.
ADIS is based on cameras mounted to vessels and artificial intelligence. In the exploratory stage of the project, we have collected over 10 million (20 TB) offshore images by outdoor, GPS-enabled action cameras. We developed an artificial intelligence object detection algorithm which automatically scans the images for floating macroplastic items. All object detections are filtered for false positives by a team of volunteers, before being aggregated into georeferenced numerical density data. In this session, we present findings from the exploratory data, as well as the future development plans. When scaled up, ADIS has the potential to provide a more continuous and global database of macroplastic (>50 cm) sea surface concentrations.
  • Closed source
  • 66/33/- (% m/f/d)
  • Private

Industrial Sectors:

Environmental tech NGO

Usage of AI:

Generation of AI:

Traditional Machine Learning (Linear Regression, CART, SVM, etc.), Deep Learning (CNN, Transformers, etc.)

initial_divs_soup:
AI4Grids

  • Konstanz, Germany
  • September 2020
  • HTWG-Konstanz
The aim of the project is to efficiently integrate the generators and consumers required for the energy transition into the medium- and low-voltage grid by means of intelligent grid management. In this way, a better synchronization of energy quantities and grid capacities is to be achieved. To achieve this, algorithms based on artificial intelligence (AI) are being developed to support the planning and operational management of power grids at the distribution grid level and of microgrids ("island grids"). As an example, in the event of a fault, an algorithm recommends a course of action to the control room in order to quickly rectify the problem.
  • Open source
  • 18/82/- (% m/f/d)
  • Public

initial_divs_soup:
AIR – AI-basierter Recommender für nachhaltigen Tourismus

  • Kiel (Location of the Network Coordinator), Germany
  • January 2022
  • It is a joint project. The coordinator is the NIT in Kiel.
In the project, the core elements of a visitor management system (frequency measurement, data provision, modelling/alternative generation and touchpoint management/deployment) are described and conceptualised and then implemented in six use cases for application research, investigated in terms of integration capability and evaluated. The use cases are located in the Allgäu, in the Ruhr area, in the Sauerland and on the North Sea and Baltic Sea coast of Schleswig-Holstein. Artificial intelligence (AI) methods are used at various points in this project, such as in the use of smart sensors for frequency measurement, in the modelling and forecasting of utilisation scenarios and in the generation and playout of recommendations to users.
  • Open source
  • 75/25/0 (% m/f/d)
  • AIR is part of the funding programme "KI-Leuchttürme für Umwelt, Klima, Natur und Ressourcen" by the German Federal Ministry for the Environment, Nature Consveration, Nucelar Safety and Consumer Protection (grant 67KI21005).

Industrial Sectors:

Professional, scientific and technical activities, Other service activities, Tourism

Usage of AI:

Data Management and Analysis, Generative Models

initial_divs_soup:
Artificial Intelligence Center Hamburg

  • Hamburg, Germany
  • March 2020
  • Artificial Intelligence Center Hamburg
The Artificial Intelligence Center Hamburg (ARIC) is your place to go considering all things AI in Hamburg and the metropolitan area. It was founded 2019 and aims to strengthen AI skills in companies, public administration and science. We support your AI projects, acting as independent AI enablers and working with experienced experts. Through various events like our monthly AI Mix & Mingle we offer you the opportunity to network and be a part of Hamburgs viable AI community. We focus on making AI understandable: Thus we created an AI showroom and host workshops, webinars and other formats that serve AI knowledge in an easily accessible way. On our conferences and in our working groups you can dive deeper into certain AI topics.
  • Closed source
  • 50/50/0 (% m/f/d)
  • mixed

It was founded 2019 and aims to strengthen AI skills in companies, public administration and science.

We support your AI projects, acting as independent AI enablers and working with experienced experts. Through various events like our monthly AI Mix & Mingle we offer you the opportunity to network and be a part of Hamburgs viable AI community.

We focus on making AI understandable: Thus we created an AI showroom and host workshops, webinars and other formats that serve AI knowledge in an easily accessible way. On our conferences and in our working groups you can dive deeper into certain AI topics.Closed source50/50/0 (% m/f/d)mixedIndustrial Sectors:Professional, scientific and technical activities, Public administration and defence; compulsory social security, Education, Human health and social work activities, Arts, entertainment and recreation, Other service activitiesUsage of AI:Natural Language Processing, Generative Models,Generation of AI:I am not sureModel training:I am not sureView full project profileClose

biaslyze - The NLP bias identification toolkit

  • Berlin, Germany
  • March 2023
Biaslyze is a python package that helps to get started with the analysis of bias within NLP models and offers a concrete entry point for further impact assessments and mitigation measures. The toolbox offers a low-effort approach to bias testing in NLP use cases using counterfactual scoring methods. All text classification models with probability output are supported.

  • 50/50/0 (% m/f/d)

initial_divs_soup:
CAIUS (Consequences of AI for Urban Societies

  • Mannheim, Germany
  • March 2021
  • University of Mannheim / Stuttgart Media University / LMU Munich
Artificial intelligence plays a key role in the implementation of smart city services, for example in detecting patterns in the usage of public services to optimize the service quality, or in the identification of unusual behaviour or measurements to trigger an alarm. The basis for such smart services is always data, which can be generated specifically for these services (such as the installation of air pollution sensors) or which can be made available from existing government data or other data sources which are relevant for the general public. This project focuses on a potential negative effect of smart cities with the question: Where do smart city applications lead to potential erosion of solidarity of the urban society?
  • Closed source
  • 78/22/0 (% m/f/d)
  • Public

Claudette

  • Florence, Italy
  • September 2017
  • European University Institute
CLAUDETTE – “automated CLAUse DETectEr” – is an interdisciplinary research project hosted at the Law Department of the European University Institute, led by professors Giovanni Sartor and Hans-W. Micklitz, in cooperation with the University of Bologna and the University of Modena and Reggio Emilia. The research objective is to test to what extent is it possible to automate the legal assessment of online consumer contracts and privacy policies, in multiple languages, to evaluate their compliance with EU’s unfair contractual terms law and personal data protection law (GDPR), using machine learning and especially neuro-symbolic approaches to provide explanations for end-users .

initial_divs_soup:
ClinicalBERT

  • New York, United States of America
  • September 2019
  • New York University, One Fact Foundation
This open source AI model aims to create reusable, transparent technology for health systems, hospitals, and clinicians. The model was trained on clinical notes from intensive care unit admissions in a Boston area hospital from tens of thousands of patients. The AI model was compared to human clinical judgment compared to clinical concept similarity, and in terms of accuracy in predicting patient readmission to a hospital. This work has now been cited 600+ times and used at several academic medical centers and hospitals to accomplish tasks such as data cleaning, extracting structured concepts such as diagnosis, prognosis, etc.

ClinicalBERT

  • New York, United States of America
  • September 2019
  • New York University, One Fact Foundation
This open source AI model aims to create reusable, transparent technology for health systems, hospitals, and clinicians. The model was trained on clinical notes from intensive care unit admissions in a Boston area hospital from tens of thousands of patients. The AI model was compared to human clinical judgment compared to clinical concept similarity, and in terms of accuracy in predicting patient readmission to a hospital.   • Guanajuato, Mexico
  • January 2022
  • PIT Policy Lab; Itad; Women in Digital Transformation, Athena Infonomics
The project aimed at improving school retention and graduation rates by identifying and then supporting at-risk students and preventing gender bias in Early Warning Systems used in the state of Guanajuato, Mexico. initial_divs_soup:
Green Consumption Assistant

  • Berlin, Germany
  • January 2021
  • Ecosia
The Green Consumption Assistant (GCA) supports sustainable consumption on Ecosia. The GCA recommends green products and provides information about more sustainable alternatives, for example in the form of hints for repair, lending, or sharing options. The basis for the GCA's recommendations is a product database (GreenDB) with ecological and social sustainability information developed with the help of machine learning methods. The GCA is a joint project between the TU Berlin, the Berliner Hochschule für Technik, and the green search engine Ecosia and is funded by the German Federal Ministry for the Environment as a lighthouse project for artificial intelligence.

  • Public

Grundlagen der KI für Unternehmen / Foundations of AI

  • Munich, Germany
  • appliedAI
Foundations of AI is a free learning opportunity on the topic of Artificial Intelligence (AI). The entry-level course can be taken at your own learning pace and is specifically designed for individuals working in a corporate setting. Our goal is to promote the use of AI in companies by enabling a basic understanding of the potential of AI with this course. The course can be taken without any particular prior knowledge, is designed to be interactive, and includes countless hands-on exercises to reinforce what has been learned.

Institute for Ethics in Artificial Intelligence

  • Munich, Germany, Germany
  • October 2019
  • Technical University of Munich
The IEAI conducts inter-, multi-, and transdisciplinary research that promotes active collaboration between the technical, engineering and social sciences, while also actively courting interaction with a wide group of international stakeholders from academia, industry and civil society. This exhaustive approach enables the IEAI to truly and comprehensively address a growing group of ethical challenges arising at the interface of technology and human values. It also aids in the development of thoroughly operational ethical frameworks in the field of AI.

initial_divs_soup:
IsoSens

  • Hamburg, Germany
  • June 2021
  • Hamburg University of Applied Sciences, Hamburg, Germany
Human consumption of fossil fuels generates about eight gigatons of atmospheric carbon per year. However, the arctic permafrost regions store at least 600, and the oceans more than 11,000 gigatons. The release of a small fraction of the bound carbon compounds from these natural sources - for example due to an increase in temperature - would lead to serious climate effects. However, a measurement of the carbon isotope ratio would allow outflows to be attributed to the type of source. The aim of the project is to develop such a sensor. It will use the latest generation of interband cascade lasers in combination with photoacoustic spectroscopy and an evaluation algorithm based on artificial intelligence.
  • Open source
  • 66/33/- (% m/f/d)
  • Public

Industrial Sectors:

Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply, Environmental protection

The release of a small fraction of the bound carbon compounds from these natural sources - for example due to an increase in temperature - would lead to serious climate effects. However, a measurement of the carbon isotope ratio would allow outflows to be attributed to the type of source. The aim of the project is to develop such a sensor. It will use the latest generation of interband cascade lasers in combination with photoacoustic spectroscopy and an evaluation algorithm based on artificial intelligence.Open source66/33/- (% m/f/d)PublicIndustrial Sectors:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply, Environmental protectionUsage of AI:Data Management and AnalysisGeneration of AI:Traditional Machine Learning (Linear Regression, CART, SVM, etc.)Model training:Supervised LearningView full project profileClose

initial_divs_soup:
KI:STE

  • Jülich, Germany
  • November 2020
  • Universities in Aachen (RWTH), Bonn and Cologne together with Forschungszentrum Jülich, and the companies 52°N and Ambroys
The project aims to exploit recent developments in artificial intelligence for environmental data analysis. The goal is the implementation of current AI approaches for spatiotemporal variable pattern recognition and pattern analysis in environmental data (for clouds, natural hazards, water, air quality and vegetation). A technical platform will be created to make powerful AI applications on environmental data available in a portable way. An online AI learning platform will be established. This e-learning offers location-independent education of young scientists. It will use the concepts and methods developed in the five research fields as teaching material.

La Independiente: Mainstreaming Gender Perspective in AI crowd work in the Global South

  • Mexico City, Guadalajara,, Mexico
  • June 2022
  • PIT Policy Lab; Universidad Nacional Autonoma de Mexico (UNAM), Northeastern University Civic AI Lab; PuentechLab
The team conducted a pilot survey of 60 women in Latin America who use the Toloka crowd-work platform to understand their personal goals, professional values, and difficulties they face in their work. Key insights revealed that most of the women shared a desire to hear about the experiences of other women who work on platforms. La Independiente will be developing a pilot of an AI-powered social connection and recommendation system, specifically designed to help collective platform workers build a supportive community and develop their technical and social skills.

  • 87/12/0 (% m/f/d)
  • International Cooperation [IDRC, Canada]

MAMMOth "Multi-Attribute, Multimodal Bias Mitigation in AI Systems"

  • Thessaloniki, Greece
  • November 2022
  • ETHNIKO KENTRO EREVNAS KAI TECHNOLOGIKIS ANAPTYXIS (CERTH)
The EU-funded MAMMOth project tackles AI bias by focusing on multi-discrimination mitigation for tabular, network and multimodal data. Working with computer science and AI experts, the project will create tools for fairness-aware AI which ensure accountability with respect to protected attributes like gender, race and age. The project will also engage with communities of vulnerable and/or underrepresented groups in AI research to ensure that user needs and pains are truly at the centre of the agenda. The end goal is to develop pilot projects for finance/loan applications, identity verification and academic evaluation.

initial_divs_soup:
MI4People

  • München, Germany
  • November 2021
  • MI4People
The idea of MI4People is to create AI applications through applied research and the use of highly qualified volunteers who help to solve humanitarian and ecological problems in our world. MI4People's projects range from AI-powered diagnosis of rare diseases for children and using AI to locate marine plastic, to fighting hunger, improving healthcare in developing countries and promoting inclusion. We aim not only to just develop AI, but to make it ready for use. The solutions are to be used by individuals or other non-profit organizations so that they can achieve their charitable purposes better and in some cases in completely new and innovative ways. All MI4People projects are open source and are implemented by our international volunteers.
  • Open source
  • 70/30/0 (% m/f/d)
  • Mix of private donation and recently some public funding

initial_divs_soup:
Quantified Trees - intelligent irrigation forecasting for city trees

  • Berlin, Germany
  • October 2021
  • Technologiestiftung Berlin
City trees are increasingly suffering from the consequences of climate change and challenges of an urban environment. With the "Quantified Trees" (QTrees) project, we want to counteract tree deaths in the long term by developing a prediction system supported by artificial intelligence (AI) that, using a wide range of databases, identifies city trees that are acutely endangered by drought at an early stage. During the project, two applications will be developed based on an AI algorithm. The applications will offer both the public administration and the civil society in Berlin the opportunity to optimise their irrigation management as well as getting involved and taking care of trees in the neighbourhood.
  • Open source
  • 80/20/0 (% m/f/d)
  • Public

Industrial Sectors:

Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities, Administrative and support service activities

Usage of AI:

Radiant MLHub

  • Washington DC, United States of America
  • December 2019
  • Radiant Earth Foundation
Radiant MLHub is a cloud-based open library dedicated to open geospatial training datasets and models generated by Radiant Earth Foundation, partners, and the community. Radiant MLHub allows anyone to access, store, register, and share open training datasets and models for high-quality Earth observations, and it’s designed to encourage widespread collaboration and the development of trustworthy applications.

initial_divs_soup:
SeaClear - SEarch, identificAtion and Collection of marine Litter with Autonomous Robots

  • Delft, Netherlands
  • January 2020
  • Delft University of Technology
Today's oceans contain 26-66 million tons of waste, with approximately 94% located on the seafloor. The SeaClear project is developing the first solution that exploits autonomous robots for underwater litter collection. We are creating a mixed team of Unmanned Underwater, Surface, and Aerial Vehicles -- UUV, USV, UAV -- to find and collect litter from coastal seabeds. The UAV and an inspection UUV maps the litter. A collection UUVs then collects litter, using a combined suction-gripper manipulator. The UUVs are tethered to offload power and computation to the USV. Our objective is to operate the robots autonomously, without remote human intervention.
  • Closed source
  • Public

Industrial Sectors:

Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities, Environmental cleanup

Usage of AI:

Computer Vision, Robotics

Generation of AI:

Traditional Machine Learning (Linear Regression, CART, SVM, etc.), Deep Learning (CNN, Transformers, etc.)

Model training:

Supervised Learning, Reinforcement Learning

initial_divs_soup:
Seismologie und Artifizielle Intelligenz

  • Frankfurt am Main, Germany
  • August 2020
  • Frankfurt Institute for Advanced Studies
The complex nature of seismic events makes it particularly challenging to efficiently extract information from the geophysical data by just using the classical statistical tools. Furthermore, due to simplified assumptions, analytical methods might encounter certain limitations. The cutting-edge research in Deep Learning/Machine learning is already providing powerful tools in handling massive data and in extracting desired features. Our group focuses on developing deep learning based tools to improve Early Warning and Forecasting of Earthquake and Volcanic events.

  • 45/55/0 (% m/f/d)
  • Federal Government Funding

target_div_texts: Seismologie und Artifizielle IntelligenzFrankfurt am Main, GermanyAugust 2020Frankfurt Institute for Advanced StudiesThe complex nature of seismic events makes it particularly challenging to efficiently extract information from the geophysical data by just using the classical statistical tools. Furthermore, due to simplified assumptions, analytical methods might encounter certain limitations. The cutting-edge research in Deep Learning/Machine learning is already providing powerful tools in handling massive data and in extracting desired features. Our group focuses on developing deep learning based tools to improve Early Warning and Forecasting of Earthquake and Volcanic events.Open source45/55/0 (% m/f/d)Federal Government FundingIndustrial Sectors:Professional, scientific and technical activitiesUsage of AI:Natural Language Processing, Computer Vision, Data Management and Analysis, Information Retrieval, Generative ModelsGeneration of AI:Traditional Machine Learning (Linear Regression, CART, SVM, etc.), Deep Learning (CNN, Transformers, etc.)Model training:Supervised Learning, Semi-supervised Learning, Unsupervised Learning, Transfer LearningView full project profileClose

SmartRecycling-UP

  • Bremen, Germany
  • January 2022
  • Deutsches Forschungszentrum für Künstliche Intelligenz
The general objective of the SmartRecycling-UP project is to achieve a significant improvement in the recycling rate and quality of large-scale waste (bulky waste, construction waste, etc.) by automating processes that were previously carried out manually. In particular, the technical prerequisites for automating the pre-sorting of large-sized waste are to be created and demonstrated. The new technology is expected to significantly increase the efficiency of the sorting process, the quality of the waste types presented and made available for recycling, and the cost-effectiveness of sorting or recycling.

initial_divs_soup:
TOP.KI (text optimisation using artificial intelligence)

  • Kassel, Germany
  • March 2023
  • Insti­tut für Text­op­timierung, Halle/Saale, der Zen­tral-Fach­aus­schuss Berufs­bildung Druck und Medien, Kas­sel, der Lehr­stuhl für Tech­no­logien und Manage­ment der Digi­talen Trans­forma­tion der Bergi­schen Uni­ver­sität Wupper­tal, die Berufs­bildungs­werke Ober­lin­haus Potsdam und Lei­pzig sowie die deep­sight GmbH in Osna­brück.
The TOP.KI project team wants to contribute to equal opportunities in examinations. Together, the participants will develop, test and evaluate a translation tool which, with the support of artificial intelligence, facilitates the creation of examination questions in easily understandable language. The questions and texts created with this tool should be easier for examinees to understand, while the content and level of difficulty remain the same. This translation into simple language will help to ensure that examination results primarily reflect the technical and application knowledge and not the text comprehension competence of the trainees.

Uwazi

  • Geneva, Switzerland
  • October 2017
  • HURIDOCS
Uwazi is a web-based tool designed for managing data in one easy-to-search place. This open-source database application allows users to capture, organise and make sense of a set of facts, observations, testimonies, research, documents and more. The entries in an Uwazi database can be made publicly available, completely private or somewhere in between. Uwazi accepts many formats, including pieces of text, PDFs, word processing documents, photos, images, video and audio.

initial_divs_soup:
vera.ai: VERification Assisted by Artificial Intelligence

  • Thessaloniki, Greece
  • September 2022
  • Information Technologies Institute of Centre for Research and Technology-Hellas (CERTH-ITI)
Online disinformation and fake media content have emerged as a serious threat to democracy, economy and society. vera.ai seeks to build professional trustworthy AI solutions against advanced disinformation techniques, co-created with and for media professionals & researchers and to also set the foundation for future research in the area of AI against disinformation. Key novel characteristics of the AI models will be fairness, transparency (incl. explainability), robustness against concept drifts, continuous adaptation to disinformation evolution through a fact-checker-in-the-loop approach, and ability to handle multimodal and multilingual content.
  • Open source
  • 60/40/0 (% m/f/d)
  • Public

vera.ai: VERification Assisted by Artificial Intelligence

  • Thessaloniki, Greece
  • September 2022
  • Information Technologies Institute of Centre for Research and Technology-Hellas (CERTH-ITI)
Online disinformation and fake media content have emerged as a serious threat to democracy, economy and society. vera.ai seeks to build professional trustworthy AI solutions against advanced disinformation techniques, co-created with and for media professionals & researchers and to also set the foundation for future research in the area of AI against disinformation. Key novel characteristics of the AI models will be fairness, transparency (incl. explainability), robustness against concept drifts, continuous adaptation to disinformation evolution through a fact-checker-in-the-loop approach, and ability to handle multimodal and multilingual content.

Zentrum für vertrauenswürdige Künstliche Intelligenz (ZVKI) resp. Center for Trustworthy Artificial Intelligence (CTAI)

  • Berlin, Germany
  • October 2021
  • Think Tank iRights.Lab, Fraunhofer AISEC, Fraunhofer IAIS, Freie Universität Berlin
As a non-partisan national organization linking the business, industry, political and civil society communities, the CTAI informs the public about consumer-relevant issues in artificial intelligence, fosters public debate on the subject and develops requirements and tools for trustworthy AI. As a forum for debate in Germany, the CTAI helps make more tangible the developments regarding the societal issues associated with artificial intelligence and algorithmic systems. The science partners at Fraunhofer AISEC and Fraunhofer IAIS as well as Freie Universität Berlin conduct research on basic requirements for trustworthy AI such as privacy, robustness, fairness and explainability.
  • Closed source
  • 50/50/0 (% m/f/d)
  • Public

Industrial Sectors:

Professional, scientific and technical activities, Education, Network; consumer protection

Usage of AI:

Education about AI, research on data-preserving ML, XAI, adversary attacks and robustness as well as on certification of AI, monitoring of AI regulation frameworks

Generation of AI:

I am not sure

Model training:

I am not sure
